body:
Sorry guys for such a scant info, I had to write it more detailed. You are right and again I tell yourself do not rush, check the problem twice. I found out what's wrong with it. Actually, we can be not inside running test
```
describe UsersController do
  describe "PUT /update" do
    it "" do
    end
  end
end
```
We can have nested describes in minitest, but for controllers (where it tries to determine controller class automatically) I have this exception.
```
/Users/route/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194@grabber/gems/actionpack-3.2.8/lib/action_dispatch/testing/assertions/routing.rb:176:in `method_missing': undefined local variable or method `method_name' for #<#<Class:0x007fac44aab390>:0x007fac40ab9200> (NameError)
from /Users/route/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194@grabber/gems/activesupport-3.2.8/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:41:in `rescue in run'
from /Users/route/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194@grabber/gems/activesupport-3.2.8/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:50:in `run'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:787:in `block in _run_suite'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:780:in `map'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:780:in `_run_suite'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:770:in `block in _run_suites'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:770:in `map'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:770:in `_run_suites'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:746:in `_run_anything'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:909:in `run_tests'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:896:in `block in _run'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:895:in `each'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:895:in `_run'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:884:in `run'
from /Users/route/.rvm/rubies/ruby-1.9.3-p194/lib/ruby/1.9.1/minitest/unit.rb:664:in `block in autorun'
```
Because it tries to resolve class name like this "UsersController::PUT /update" and safe_constantize gives us error which is caught by this rescue https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/3-2-stable/activesupport/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb#L40 and in that moment method_name doesn't exist.

I've updated my PR, WDYT about this decision?
BTW I have to check it against master.
